title: Here's How I'd Run the Fed
text:
Only those of us who lived through the late 1970s and early 1980s can remember seeing 30-year treasury bonds paying 13.5%. Short-term rates on T-bills and money markets went even higherNormal Americans who had saved money could earn excellent risk-free returns on FDIC or U.S. government-backed paper, paying double-digit interest ratesWhy were coup...

There's no substitute for a trading floor to get great ideas, so Jim Cramer created a better one at Real Money and blogs there exclusively. description: What would I do if I were appointed Fed Chief? Here's what.
authors: Here'S How I'D Run The Fed
I Would Take My Finger Off The Scale
Go Back To The Days Of True Debt Auctions Where 'The Market' Set Interest Rates Based On Inflation Risk
